body.p: To His Excellency B MaGoffin Govr of Ky

The undersigned Nelson Alley and James Ford represent that at the term 1860 of the Nelson Circuit Court a Judgment was rendered against them for $500 & cash upon a forfeited recognizance for the appearance of Thomas J Montgue at Said Court who had been Indicted for Stealing a coat & pair of pantaloons from D B. Coyle

They represent that Montague was about 17 years of age of very weak mind. That he and Coyle were very intimate and had been in the habut of wearing each others clothes. That the young man did not pretend to deny taking the clothes at the time and that Coyle was anxious that he should be re-fered
We therefor pray your Excellency to remit Said Judgment fees & costs excepted

J. Dudley
James Shannon
Jno Rodman
D. B. Coyle
John Coyle
E H Chamberlin
W. S. Buford
Wm A Moore
W. H. Greenup
Midway
Ky

Nelson Cir. Ct
$500. } For Recognizance
Remitted
B. M
Jas Ford &
Nelson Alley
Issd Feby 15th 1861
